section1.name: Factorial
content: A factorial is defined as the product of all natural numbers up to a given number. It is represented as 'n factorial' and written as n!. This means n! equals n times (n minus 1) times (n minus 2), and so on, down to 1.
Factorials can be expressed in terms of smaller factorials. For example, 5! = 5 × 4!, and 4! = 4 × 3!, and so on, until we reach 1!

section2.name: Permutation
content: Permutation refers to the number of different arrangements that can be made by taking some or all of a given set of things at a time. The order of arrangement matters.
For example, arranging two numbers, A and B, gives two different permutations: AB and BA.
The number of permutations of 'n' things taken 'n' at a time is denoted as nPn = n!, and the number of permutations of 'n' things taken 0 at a time is 1.
The formula for permutation is: nPr = n! / (n - r)!

section3.name: Combination
content: Combination refers to the number of ways in which a set of things can be selected. In combination, the order of selection does not matter.
For example, if selecting two numbers A and B, AB and BA are counted as one combination.
The formula for combination is: nCr = n! / (r! × (n - r)!)
The relationship between combinations is: nCr = nC(n - r). The sum of all combinations from nC0 to nCn is equal to 2^n.

section4.name: Permutation vs Combination
content: Permutation is used when we want to arrange 'r' things out of 'n' things, and combination is used when we want to select 'r' things from 'n'.
In permutation, the order of arrangement matters, whereas in combination, the order does not matter.
Formula for permutation: nPr = n! / (n - r)!, Formula for combination: nCr = n! / (r! × (n - r)!)

questions.question: What is the formula for the number of permutations of 'n' things taken 'r' at a time?
How many permutations can be made from 3 objects A, B, and C?
What is the formula for combination?

options: a) Permutation considers the order, while combination does not
b) Permutation does not consider the order, while combination does
questions.answer: a) Permutation considers the order, while combination does not
